conclusion: To find the power of the external force doing work, consider the induced EMF in the rotating rod and the resulting current through the resistor.
The rod OC rotates with an angular velocity ω in a magnetic field B.
The length of the rod is r.
The induced EMF (𝓔) in the rod is calculated using the formula: 𝓔 = B ⋅ v ⋅ l.
The velocity v of the end of the rod is given by v = ω ⋅ r.
The induced EMF is: 𝓔 = B ⋅ ω ⋅ r².
The current I through the resistor R is found using Ohm's Law: I = 𝓔/R = B ⋅ ω ⋅ r²/R.
The power P dissipated in the resistor is given by: P = I² ⋅ R.
Substituting the expression for I: P = (B² ⋅ ω² ⋅ r⁴)/R.
The power of the external force doing work is: P = (B² ⋅ ω² ⋅ r⁴)/R.
